reply_context.text: To your point about "not sure what a US invasion of Greenland would even mean": yes, we have troops there, but we are still respecting Greenlands autonomous land rights. The ostensive justification the administration claims is national security, but the reality is Greenland's mineral wealth.

posts.text: To your point about "not sure what a US invasion of Greenland would even mean": yes, we have troops there, but we are still respecting Greenlands autonomous land rights. The ostensive justification the administration claims is national security, but the reality is Greenland's mineral wealth.

reply_context.text: At the very least, it means that NATO is taking the US's rhetoric towards Greenland seriously, and adopting a posture antagonistic towards stated US intentions. NATO historically has shown significant deference to the US, so even the semblance of direct opposition is a pretty big statement/change.

posts.text: At the very least, it means that NATO is taking the US's rhetoric towards Greenland seriously, and adopting a posture antagonistic towards stated US intentions. posts.text: Imagine if the commoditization of music took us full circle back to dance halls featuring house bands.

reply_context.text: 90s?! That time was dominated by record sales (CDs). We should go way further back, before WWII, when the only thing there was was live music. But yea, it's interesting to see if the scene really shifts more towards live-culture (and how/if this affects the content).

posts.text:
Maybe an upside for *fans*. This phenomenon is tremendously unfair to the artists.

Touring is an extremely challenging lifestyle that promotes substance abuse and makes it hard to maintain intimate relationships. Moreover: all musicians aren't performers, and all performers aren't travelers.

reply_context.text: The Enshittification of the Music Industry has an upside, and it's the fact bands now need to tour constantly in order to support themselves via ticket sales and merch. It's good because now you get the chance to meet and see awesome bands live every week, even in third-rate countries (like mine)

posts.text: yes: matters "could" be more complicated, and that's why the researchers work was justified. But what they found is that no, they are in fact no, so your phrasing was clickbait and I'm justified to be annoyed.

reply_context.text: I'm grouchy because the way you phrased your snippet made it sound like the intuitive hypothesis was rejected by the findings, and if you'd linked the article directly it would have embedded the title and saved me the time and frustration of reading that no, my original intuition was correct.

reply_context.text: The article you linked doesn't seem to corroborate your hinted "complicating matters".
